author: Bruno Le Maire
title: 2137 - Joint presse release from Bruno LE MAIRE, minister for the Economy and Finance of France and Wopke HOEKSTRA, minister of Finance of the Netherlands, on the support of the Air France-KLM Group
text:
1/1	
	
 
Paris, 24 April 2020	
 
 
 
 
Joint presse release  
 
from Bruno LE MAIRE, minister for the Economy and Finance of France 
and Wopke HOEKSTRA, minister of Finance of the Netherlands,  
on the support of the Air France-KLM Group 
 
 
Ministers Bruno Le Maire and Wopke Hoekstra share the same priority for Air France-KLM: take all 
necessary measures both in France and in the Netherlands to help the Group overcome this severe 
pandemic crisis. Today, all efforts are devoted to respond to this unprecedented shock, and therefore 
their unique focus right now is preserving the financial and operational situation of the Air France KLM 
Group.  
 
Therefore, at the request of Air France-KLM, the French government has decided to provide financial 
support to Air France and has notified it to the European Commission. The Dutch government has the 
intention to support KLM and is currently discussing it with the European Commission. The two 
governments, which are the two main shareholders of Air France-KLM, want to support Air France-KLM 
Group through these difficult times with the view to recover its competitiveness consistent with strong 
sustainable development commitments.  
 
Ministers Le Maire and Hoekstra agreed to stay in close contact on these issues, as they did so far.
